channel.title: Connection help please
channel.description: Hey guys im trying to run my rsps and my client connects just fine to it but when i downloaded the client to a different computer with my no-ip on the client i couldnt connect and when i tryed mopars online client it wouldnt connect i noticed that when i start the run server it says Server listening on port 127.0.01:43594 So i launched another server i had just to test it and it said Server listening on port 43594:43594 and i could connect to the server via webclient? does anyone know what my problem is or how i may fix it? any help is GREATLY appreciated!

item.title: Connection help please
item.dc:creator: @fish_iz_ill fish iz ill
item.description:
@fish_iz_ill wrote:

what source are you using tank??

Read full topic

item.title: Connection help please
item.dc:creator: @Sp3cTank Sp3cTank
item.description:
@Sp3cTank wrote:

I am having this same problem, and I used portfoward.com to portforward and it says my port is open when I check it.

Read full topic

item.title: Connection help please
item.dc:creator: @fish_iz_ill fish iz ill
item.description:
@fish_iz_ill wrote:

when i checked it on http://www.canyouseeme.org/ (port checker) it said it was open and could see me. so should i just start over with a new server and client? or what?

Read full topic

item.title: Connection help please
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

your not portforward properly or your server is only allowing one connection to login from your isp

Read full topic

item.description:
@fish_iz_ill wrote:

Hey guys im trying to run my rsps and my client connects just fine to it but when i downloaded the client to a different computer with my no-ip on the client i couldnt connect and when i tryed mopars online client it wouldnt connect i noticed that when i start the run server it says

So i launched another server i had just to test it and it said

does anyone know what my problem is or how i may fix it? any help is GREATLY appreciated!
